newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: MARADONA'S MANAGER TRIES TO OUST DRUGS CASE JUDGE.
newsitem.headline: MARADONA'S MANAGER TRIES TO OUST DRUGS CASE JUDGE.

text.p: The manager of Argentine soccer great Diego Maradona on Monday requested a judge investigating him for alleged drug-trafficking be declared incompetent on technical grounds, his attorney said.

Lawyer Mariano Cuneo Liberona said his client Guillermo Coppola requested Judge Hernan Bernasconi be replaced in the case because Coppola's apartment -- the scene of a raid last week -- was outside the judge's jurisdiction, the state-owned Telam news agency reported.

Coppola has been in custody since surrendering to police at the end of a day on the run after investigators said they found a pound (500 grams) of cocaine in a flower vase in a raid at his luxury Buenos Aires apartment.
Cuneo Liberona said Coppola repeated his plea of innocence on Monday and said again that any cocaine found was not his.
But state prosecutor Jorge Mola said, "There is enough evidence to lay charges," according to Telam.

Coppola's permanent tan-and-white hair have appeared regularly in Argentine glossy magazines and social pages for years, as a leading member of an Argentine jet-set of sports stars, models, actors and politicians.

Some Maradona fans blame Coppola for their idol's drug habit, which earned him a 15-month suspension after a dope test in the U.S. World Cup. Maradona admitted a drug problem and went to a Swiss clinic last month, but a few days later he smashed up a Spanish hotel and was then accused of switching urine tests after a random post-match drug test.
